title: The recreations of Christopher North
author: Wilson, John
snippet: Northwards one fierce torrent dashes through the centre — but no villages  — only a few woodmen's shielings will appear on its banks ; for it is a torrent of precipices,  where the shrubs that hang midway from the cleft are out of the reach of the spray of its cataracts, even when the red Garroch is in flood.
